  2. Has Microsoft's AI Chief Just Made Windows Free?  Forbes
  3. The internet is not a free-for-all—we shouldn't let big tech companies wish copyright out of existence  PC Gamer
  4. Microsoft AI head Mustafa Suleyman says anyone can use information on internet to train their AI models for free  Business Today
  5. Ever put content on the web? Microsoft says that it's okay for them to steal it because it's 'freeware.'  Windows Central

item.title: Live news: Samsung Electronics expects 15-fold profit rise on AI demand - Financial Times
item.description:
1. Live news: Samsung Electronics expects 15-fold profit rise on AI demand  Financial Times

  3. Samsung's Profit Grows Fastest in Years After AI Propels Chips  Bloomberg
  4. Samsung flags better-than-expected rise in second-quarter profit as chip prices jump By Reuters  Investing.com
  5. Samsung Electronics Expects Surge in Second-Quarter Profit  The Wall Street Journal

item.title: Blocking AI Bots From Scraping Websites Gets Boost From Cloudflare - Decrypt
item.description:
1. Blocking AI Bots From Scraping Websites Gets Boost From Cloudflare  Decrypt
  2. Cloudflare debuts one-click nuke of web-scraping AI  The Register
  3. Cloudflare rolls out feature for blocking AI companies’ web scrapers  SiliconANGLE News
  4. Cloudflare is offering to block crawlers scraping information for AI bots.  The Verge
  5. Cloudflare launches a tool to combat AI bots  TechCrunch
